subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: Note that the {{w|Ming (typefaces)|Ming typeface}} used in Japan and Korea as well as the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}} uses a vertical dot for the upper component of <font size=5, lang=ja>[[亠#Translingual|亠]]</font> which is slightly different from modern Chinese scripts which uses a slanting {{l|mul|丶}} dot for the upper component of <font size=5, lang=zh>[[亠#Translingual|亠]]</font> in <font size=5, lang=zh>{{l|mul|市}}</font>.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=191|rad=鬥|as=05|sn=15|four=77227|canj=LNYLB|ids=⿵鬥市(GHTKV),⿵鬥巿(J)}} <!-- Note: ⿵鬥巿 is incorrect and is not used in Korea. 亠 and 巾 is separated not combined together. If you zoom into the Unicode charts at 500% the serif hook is visible at the top right corner of 巾. -->

subSections.title: Related characters
subSections.text:
